definition:
A is a norm on the set $M_{m\times n}(R)$ of $m\times n$ matrices over a
ring $R$, and is usually denoted by $||\cdot||$.

The Frobenius matrix norm $||\cdot||_F$ and the $||\cdot||_p$ are the
most frequently used matrix norms.

A vector norm is a matrix norm for which the ring $R$ is a field.
